background: The Banks Lake creel protocol was formulated from those described in Pollock et al. (1994), and Malvestuto (1983) as a monitoring and evaluation tool to estimate harvest rates of Kokanee stocked into the lake from the Ford State (project 2001-029-00) and Spokane Tribal hatcheries (project 1991-46-00). The creel also lended a means to monitor and evaluate the populations of Kokanee competitors including Lake Whitefish, Walleye, and Smallmouth Bass.
title: Creel Monitoring for the Banks Lake Fishery
assumptions: A key assumption is that a representative sample of anglers is intercepted so that the entire fishery is represented.
objectives:
Quantify spatial and temporal catch and harvest of Kokanee 
Compare harvest rates to baseline collected since 2002.
Quantify spatial and temporal catch of Kokanee, Lake Whitefish, Walleye, Smallmouth Bass, and other pertinent sport fish targeted by anglers.
